File libsrc/libgODBC/ODBCInsertTables.c

These routines insert one or more records into the database.

All data is transfered to the ODBC server by binding to memory locations. (Insert statments use the '?' character to denote bound parameters.)

Public Function Index

ODBCInsertTable (SQLHDBC, const char *, CssTable)
Insert one table record.
ODBCInsertTables (SQLHDBC, const char *, int, CssTable *)
Insert more than one table record.

Public Functions

ODBCInsertTable 
 int ODBCInsertTable(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                     const char *tableName,
                     CssTable table)
Insert one table record.

Parameters:
hdbc - The ODBC connection handle.
tableName - The database table name, with an account prefix if needed.
table - The CssTable object whose elements will be inserted.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 for failure. Retrieve the error number and the error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
ODBCInsertTables 
 int ODBCInsertTables(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                      const char *tableName,
                      int num,
                      CssTable *tables)
Insert more than one table record.

Parameters:
hdbc - The ODBC connection handle.
tableName - The database table name, with an account prefix if needed.
num - The number of records to insert from tables[].
tables - The CssTable objects whose elements will be inserted.
Returns:
the number of records inserted. If less than num, retrieve the error number and the error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
